section.sentence: Three little crows with big straw hats all danced to the light of the moon.
Their ________ kerfuffled, their feet did shuffle, for the harvest was meant to come soon.
section.definition: Light growths that make up the outer covering of the body of a bird.

section.sentence: "Woo-hoo! Hooray!" The crows did cry, as their _____ feet did a sashay.
section.definition: Showing or causing feelings of pleasure and enjoyment.

section.sentence: "The harvest is near! And don't you see, dear? We'll dance till the very next day."
There'll be corn, beets, ________, and such. Zucchini, carrots, and also some squash.
section.definition: a round root of a plant that has brown, yellow, or red skin and white or yellow flesh and that is eaten as a vegetable.

section.sentence: A whole ______ spread, with juice and cornbread, I'm sure we'll all feel very posh.
section.definition: The season between summer and winter.

section.sentence: We'll gobble it down, till our bellies are round, our ______ work has come to an end.
section.definition: The warmest season of the year that is after spring and before autumn.

section.sentence: Our hard work is done, so let's have some fun! ______ is just 'round the bend.
section.definition: The coldest season of the year that is after autumn and before spring.

section.sentence: Three little _____ with big straw hats all danced to the light of the moon.
section.definition: A large black bird that has a loud and harsh cry.

section.sentence: With smiles and glee and good company, they sang proud their own harvest tune.
